page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: The {landscape} is chalk downland and the plain of the Thames.A long {local history} dates back to the Neolithic and includes the Roman Icknield way and Saxon and other place names.The only village is North Stoke. {Housing} is varied in the area.The church at North Stoke and synagogue at Carmel College are contrasts in {religion},the latter a feature of {education},a Jewish public school.Lar ge scale {farming} predominates with cereals,pigs and sheep.Most of the land is arable with some pasture by the river.{Transport}consists of a few main roads and a criss cross of narrow lanes.Part of the proposed route for the Wallingford bypass is in this area. {Health} is represented by the Wallingford Community Hospital.The Springs Hotel is a feature of {tourism}.
